summary.title: El Libro de los Epítomes that belonged to Hernando Colón (Ferdinand Columbus)

msItem.title: El Libro de los Epítomes [The Book of Epitomes]
msItem.explicit: contra sylla iam mortui acta pro concione agentem de
msItem.note: Acephalous. Begins in the middle of record no. 140. The last entry is no. 2330, whose text is incomplete due to damage to the last leaves of the manuscript.

supportDesc.extent: i + 974 + vii. Fols 297-302, 311-318 and 605-618 are blank. Size of leaves: 308 215 .
supportDesc.foliation: Foliated 1-973 in blue pencil on the top right-hand corner, excluding the front and end flyleaves and the leaf between 451 and 452 (now 451bis).

condition.p: Fols 297, 298, 299, 311, 313, 315, 613, 616 and 617, all of which are blank, are partly torn and damaged. Fols 957-973 are damaged on the outer side of the leaves and have been repaired after the manuscript was foliated.

layout.p: Written in one column throughout; 20-41 lines per page.

handDesc.summary: Written in more than one hand.

additions.p: Marginal notes and corrections by Hernando Colón.
Signature V. 339 in light brown ink on the top left corner of fol. 1r, signature E·.5 in black ink on the middle of the top margin of fol. 1r.

bindingDesc.p: Modern, grey cardboard binding, probably dating back to the 1770s, during when Matthias Larsen Bloch is known to have bound several of the manuscripts in the collection.

origin.p: The manuscript was prepared under the direction of Hernando Colón and was written in Seville, Spain, over a period of time in the first half of the sixteenth century, before Hernando Colón's death in 1539.

provenance.p: The manuscript was in the possession of Cornelius Pedersen Lerche at the time of his death and is mentioned in the 1682 auction catalogue under folio manuscripts as no. 10 (See Catalogus, p. 166).

It is recorded as 377. De variis authoribus, eorumque scriptis judicia, signatus est liber E. S. in the old manuscript catalogues of the Arnamagnæan Collection prepared by Jón Ólafsson after Árni Magnússon's death in 1730. The same description is also repeated in Kålund's Katalog, with further explanation in Danish, Udførligt (ikke nordisk) forfatter-lexicon, på Latin [Comprehensive dictionary of (non-Nordic) authors, in Latin]. The signature reads E·.5 and not E. S. as previously reported in these catalogues.

history.acquisition: There is no record of acquisition.
